Hawley told Tucker that having Honor√© lead a security review is absolutely outrageous.

"This is a guy who did what we‚Äôve seen liberals do time and again ‚Äì he blamed the police first," Hawley said. "Blaming the police and saying...they helped the rioters." https://www.foxnews.com/politics/hawley-decries-absolutely-outrageous-gen-honore-appointment

"The bill is targeting folks who are making $34k-$35k a year and less," Hawley tells @alaynatreene. "This is targeted toward people who have been the hardest hit, who are trying to get back on their feet." https://www.axios.com/hawley-minimum-wage-tax-credits-2087ac1e-a007-4095-b2b8-c0aa6d202dc2.html

Hawley: "Wages for blue-collar workers have been stagnant for decades. And government made the problem worse by shutting down the economy a year ago. It‚Äôs time we give blue-collar workers some respect and a pay raise."

For example, an American worker making $12/hour would be eligible for a $2.25/hour credit.

[($16.50-$12.00)/2] = $2.25

The maximum credit would be for 40 hours of work a week, allowing this full-time worker a total credit of $4,680 for the taxable year.

HOW IT WORKS ‚Äî The credit is worth 50% of the difference between the median wage and the worker‚Äôs hourly wage rate.

In other words, the credit would boost per hour wages 50% closer to the median. The median wage is set at $16.50 per hour and will be indexed to inflation.

Workers would receive the bonus directly through an automatic, advanceable tax credit tied to hours worked. Unlike other proposals to raise wages, this plan does not place a major new burden on small businesses, many of which are still recovering from harmful shutdowns.

NEW ‚Äî Senator Josh Hawley is announcing new legislation that will give blue-collar workers a pay raise. His plan would provide a bonus to every worker making below the median wage. https://www.hawley.senate.gov/senator-hawley-announces-blue-collar-bonus-pay-raise-american-workers

@JoeBiden 91% of the nearly $2 TRILLION @JoeBiden and @SpeakerPelosi‚Äôs ‚ÄúCOVID relief‚Äù package will be spent on things unrelated to coronavirus or our economic recovery. They‚Äôre using this bill to radically expand federal spending and pass big-ticket items off their wish list.
@JoeBiden The bill includes healthcare benefits, stimulus payments, and unemployment benefits for people illegally in our country. This is a blatant waste and misuse of taxpayer dollars.

@JoeBiden A 3rd round of stimulus payments costing over $422 BILLION will include households that haven't experienced financial loss during the pandemic because no one is working to target the relief. We had a full year to develop a better plan, there is no excuse for reckless spending.

@JoeBiden An added $400/week (in addition to regular unemployment payments) incentivizes workers to remain out of the workforce. Our economy will recover as quickly or as slowly as we get our people back to work.

@JoeBiden $86 BILLION bailing out union pensions, $200 MILLION for the Institute of Museum and Library Services, and $135 MILLION for the National Endowment of the Arts ‚Äì these have nothing to do with COVID relief and could easily be eliminated from this package.

@JoeBiden $350 BILLION to bail out blue states for mismanagement issues that existed long before COVID-19. These funds do not help us eradicate the virus, distribute vaccines, or reopen our economy ‚Äì the only things we should focus on with any relief package.
@JoeBiden Raising the minimum wage by 107% will kill 1.4 million jobs and economists on both sides are advising against it. This comes at the cost of $56 BILLION to the taxpayers.

@JoeBiden This bill changes PPP rules to allow Planned Parenthood to receive PPP loans and requires taxpayers to subsidize health plans that cover elective abortions. These are both unnecessary for COVID relief and could easily be cut from the bill.
@JoeBiden There are still $68 BILLION allocated specifically to K-12 schools leftover from previous relief packages. @JoeBiden why can‚Äôt we use these funds instead of appropriating new money?

@JoeBiden $130 BILLION to schools with zero requirements for schools to open. 
 95% of these funds won‚Äôt be spent until 2022 - we need to get our students back in class TODAY. Instead of funding closed schools, fund the parents who have taken on the burden of those shutdowns.

During the 1918 influenza pandemic, Dr. Roberts tirelessly treated patients from Ponte Vedra to Ormand Beach. According to local legend, he didn't lose a single patient to the pandemic. He was tragically killed at age 52 in an auto accident due to his constant travels.

Dr. Daniel Webster Roberts was the first Black physician in St. Augustine, Florida, a town which would become central to the Civil Rights Movement.
 
Forgotten by some local histories, in the early 1900s he had "the largest medical practice in Florida." #BlackHistoryMonth http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EvA3XDzXMA4uMyO.jpg
